title: Home Depot Executive Adolfo Villagomez to Be New CEO of Progress Residential; Company is one of the largest rental-home managers in the country
text:
The company cited Mr. Villagomez's record of boosting revenue for a consumer-facing business as one reason for his hire. He begins his tenure as CEO next week.

Progress is in the midst of growing its already large portfolio of rental houses, which it said now numbers more than 80,000, making the company one of the largest rental-home managers in the country. Its recent acquisitions include the purchase of more than 3,000 homes from Zillow Offers, Zillow Group Inc.'s nowclosed house-flipping unit.

Born in Mexico City and trained as a chemical engineer, Mr. Villagomez worked for DuPont and McKinsey & Co. before moving to Home Depot in 2014. He most recently served as the president of Homedepot.com and as the company's chief marketing officer for U.S. retail.

Though he hasn't previously worked for a large real-estate company, Mr. Villagomez worked with construction clients at McKinsey and with contractors and large property companies at Home Depot, he said.

One of his top goals for the new post is improving tenant experiences, Mr. Villagomez said.

"Other industries have gone through this transformation of delivering a personalized experience that customers love. I think it's time for the single family-rental business to accelerate that and provide this to our residents," he said.

During the pandemic the single-family rental industry has been flush with investment capital and investor buyers now account for the greatest share of U.S. home sales that they ever have, according to real-estate company Redfin. Some investors, including Pretium, are also putting large sums into the construction of new single-family homes that are rented instead of sold.
